segments.en: Linked Discourses 55
6. A Wise Person
53. With Dhammadinna

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā bārāṇasiyaṃ viharati isipatane migadāye.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana.

segments.pli: Atha kho dhammadinno upāsako pañcahi upāsakasatehi saddhiṃ yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho dhammadinno upāsako bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the lay follower Dhammadinna, together with five hundred lay followers, went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:
“May the Buddha please advise

segments.pli: anusāsatu no, bhante, bhagavā yaṃ amhākaṃ assa dīgharattaṃ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.
segments.en: and instruct us. It will be for our lasting welfare and happiness.”
“So, Dhammadinna, you should train like this:

segments.pli: ‘ye te suttantā tathāgatabhāsitā gambhīrā gambhīratthā lokuttarā suññatapaṭisaṃyuttā te kālena kālaṃ upasampajja viharissāmā’ti.
segments.en: ‘From time to time we will undertake and dwell upon the discourses spoken by the Realized One that are deep, profound, transcendent, dealing with emptiness.’
That’s how you should train yourselves.”

segments.pli: “Na kho netaṃ, bhante, sukaraṃ amhehi puttasambādhasayanaṃ ajjhāvasantehi kāsikacandanaṃ paccanubhontehi mālāgandhavilepanaṃ dhārayantehi jātarūparajataṃ sādiyantehi—
segments.en: “Sir, we live at home with our children, using sandalwood imported from Kāsi, wearing garlands, perfumes, and makeup, and accepting gold and money.

segments.pli: ye te suttantā tathāgatabhāsitā gambhīrā gambhīratthā lokuttarā suññatapaṭisaṃyuttā te kālena kālaṃ upasampajja viharituṃ.
segments.en: It’s not easy for us to undertake and dwell from time to time upon the discourses spoken by the Realized One that are deep, profound, transcendent, dealing with emptiness.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ no, bhante, bhagavā amhākaṃ pañcasu sikkhāpadesu ṭhitānaṃ uttaridhammaṃ desetū”ti.
segments.en: Since we are established in the five training rules, please teach us further.”
“So, Dhammadinna, you should train like this:
‘We will have experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

segments.en: the teaching …
the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgatā bhavissāma akhaṇḍehi … pe … samādhisaṃvattanikehī’ti.
segments.en: And we will have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.’
That’s how you should train yourselves.”

segments.pli: “Yānimāni, bhante, bhagavatā cattāri sotāpattiyaṅgāni desitāni, saṃvijjante dhammā amhesu, mayañca tesu dhammesu sandissāma.
segments.en: “Sir, these four factors of stream-entry that were taught by the Buddha are found in us, and we embody them.
For we have experiential confidence in the Buddha …

segments.pli: itipi so bhagavā … pe … satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavāti.

segments.en: the teaching …
the Saṅgha …

segments.pli: ariyakantehi sīlehi samannāgatā akhaṇḍehi … pe … samādhisaṃvattanikehī”ti.
segments.en: And we have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.”
“You’re fortunate, Dhammadinna, so very fortunate!
You have all declared the fruit of stream-entry.”

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Benares,…

suttaplex.blurb: The lay follower Dhammadinna leads a group of 500 to visit the Buddha. He encourages them to study deep discourses, but they protest that they don’t have enough time. So the Buddha encourages them in the four factors of stream-entry.
